trans-unit.source: GRANT

seg-source.mrk: GRANT

target.mrk: GRANT

trans-unit.source: Use the GRANT statement to give privileges to a specific user or role, or to all users, to perform actions on database objects. You can also use the GRANT statement to grant a role to a user, to PUBLIC, or to another role.

seg-source.mrk: Use the GRANT statement to give privileges to a specific user or role, or to all users, to perform actions on database objects.
You can also use the GRANT statement to grant a role to a user, to PUBLIC, or to another role.

target.mrk: Use the GRANT statement to give privileges to a specific user or role, or to all users, to perform actions on database objects.
You can also use the GRANT statement to grant a role to a user, to PUBLIC, or to another role.

trans-unit.source: The following types of privileges can be granted:

seg-source.mrk: The following types of privileges can be granted:

target.mrk: The following types of privileges can be granted:

trans-unit.source: Delete data from a specific table.

seg-source.mrk: Delete data from a specific table.

target.mrk: Delete data from a specific table.

trans-unit.source: Insert data into a specific table.

seg-source.mrk: Insert data into a specific table.

target.mrk: Insert data into a specific table.

trans-unit.source: Create a foreign key reference to the named table or to a subset of columns from a table.

seg-source.mrk: Create a foreign key reference to the named table or to a subset of columns from a table.

target.mrk: Create a foreign key reference to the named table or to a subset of columns from a table.

trans-unit.source: Select data from a table, view, or a subset of columns in a table.

seg-source.mrk: Select data from a table, view, or a subset of columns in a table.

target.mrk: Select data from a table, view, or a subset of columns in a table.

trans-unit.source: Create a trigger on a table.

seg-source.mrk: Create a trigger on a table.

target.mrk: Create a trigger on a table.

trans-unit.source: Update data in a table or in a subset of columns in a table.

seg-source.mrk: Update data in a table or in a subset of columns in a table.

target.mrk: Update data in a table or in a subset of columns in a table.

trans-unit.source: Run a specified function or procedure.

seg-source.mrk: Run a specified function or procedure.

target.mrk: Run a specified function or procedure.

trans-unit.source: Use a sequence generator, a user-defined type, or a user-defined aggregate.

seg-source.mrk: Use a sequence generator, a user-defined type, or a user-defined aggregate.

target.mrk: Use a sequence generator, a user-defined type, or a user-defined aggregate.

trans-unit.source: Before you issue a GRANT statement, check that the derby.database.sqlAuthorization property is set to true. The derby.database.sqlAuthorization property enables the SQL Authorization mode.

seg-source.mrk: Before you issue a GRANT statement, check that the derby.database.sqlAuthorization property is set to true.
The derby.database.sqlAuthorization property enables the SQL Authorization mode.

target.mrk: Before you issue a GRANT statement, check that the derby.database.sqlAuthorization property is set to true.
The derby.database.sqlAuthorization property enables the SQL Authorization mode.

trans-unit.source: You can grant privileges on an object if you are the owner of the object or the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>. See the CREATE statement for the database object that you want to grant privileges on for more information.

seg-source.mrk: You can grant privileges on an object if you are the owner of the object or the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>.
See the CREATE statement for the database object that you want to grant privileges on for more information.

target.mrk: You can grant privileges on an object if you are the owner of the object or the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref>.
See the CREATE statement for the database object that you want to grant privileges on for more information.

trans-unit.source: The syntax that you use for the GRANT statement depends on whether you are granting privileges to a schema object or granting a role.

seg-source.mrk: The syntax that you use for the GRANT statement depends on whether you are granting privileges to a schema object or granting a role.

target.mrk: The syntax that you use for the GRANT statement depends on whether you are granting privileges to a schema object or granting a role.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the GRANT statement, see "Using SQL standard authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information on using the GRANT statement, see "Using SQL standard authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information on using the GRANT statement, see "Using SQL standard authorization" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: Syntax for tables

seg-source.mrk: Syntax for tables

target.mrk: Syntax for tables

trans-unit.source: GRANT privilegeType ON [ TABLE ] { | } TO grantees

seg-source.mrk: GRANT privilegeType ON [ TABLE ] { | } TO grantees

target.mrk: GRANT privilegeType ON [ TABLE ] { | } TO grantees

seg-source.mrk: Syntax for routines

target.mrk: Syntax for routines

trans-unit.source: GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION functionName TO grantees

target.mrk: GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION functionName TO grantees

trans-unit.source: GRANT EXECUTE ON PROCEDURE procedureName TO grantees

seg-source.mrk: GRANT EXECUTE ON PROCEDURE procedureName TO grantees

target.mrk: GRANT EXECUTE ON PROCEDURE procedureName TO grantees

trans-unit.source: Syntax for sequence generators

seg-source.mrk: Syntax for sequence generators

target.mrk: Syntax for sequence generators

trans-unit.source: GRANT USAGE ON SEQUENCE sequenceName TO grantees

seg-source.mrk: GRANT USAGE ON SEQUENCE sequenceName TO grantees

target.mrk: GRANT USAGE ON SEQUENCE sequenceName TO grantees

trans-unit.source: In order to use a sequence generator, you must have the USAGE privilege on it. This privilege can be granted to users and to roles. See <xref href="rrefsqljcreatesequence.dita#rrefsqljcreatesequence"></xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: In order to use a sequence generator, you must have the USAGE privilege on it.
This privilege can be granted to users and to roles.
See <xref href="rrefsqljcreatesequence.dita#rrefsqljcreatesequence"></xref> for more information.

target.mrk: In order to use a sequence generator, you must have the USAGE privilege on it.
This privilege can be granted to users and to roles.
See <xref href="rrefsqljcreatesequence.dita#rrefsqljcreatesequence"></xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: GRANT USAGE ON TYPE typeName TO grantees

target.mrk: GRANT USAGE ON TYPE typeName TO grantees

trans-unit.source: In order to use a user-defined type, you must have the USAGE privilege on it. This privilege can be granted to users and to roles. See <xref href="rrefsqljcreatetype.dita#rrefsqljcreatetype"></xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: In order to use a user-defined type, you must have the USAGE privilege on it.
This privilege can be granted to users and to roles.
See <xref href="rrefsqljcreatetype.dita#rrefsqljcreatetype"></xref> for more information.

target.mrk: In order to use a user-defined type, you must have the USAGE privilege on it.
This privilege can be granted to users and to roles.
See <xref href="rrefsqljcreatetype.dita#rrefsqljcreatetype"></xref> for more information.

target.mrk: GRANT USAGE ON DERBY AGGREGATE aggregateName TO grantees

trans-unit.source: In order to use a user-defined aggregate, you must have the USAGE privilege on it. This privilege can be granted to users and to roles. See <xref href="rrefsqljcreateaggregate.dita#rrefsqljcreateaggregate"></xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: In order to use a user-defined aggregate, you must have the USAGE privilege on it.
This privilege can be granted to users and to roles.
See <xref href="rrefsqljcreateaggregate.dita#rrefsqljcreateaggregate"></xref> for more information.

target.mrk: In order to use a user-defined aggregate, you must have the USAGE privilege on it.
This privilege can be granted to users and to roles.
See <xref href="rrefsqljcreateaggregate.dita#rrefsqljcreateaggregate"></xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Syntax for roles

seg-source.mrk: Syntax for roles

target.mrk: Syntax for roles

trans-unit.source: GRANT roleName [ , roleName ]* TO grantees

seg-source.mrk: GRANT roleName [ , roleName ]* TO grantees

target.mrk: GRANT roleName [ , roleName ]* TO grantees

trans-unit.source: Before you can grant a role to a user or to another role, you must create the role using the <xref href="rrefcreaterole.dita#rrefcreaterole">CREATE ROLE statement</xref>. Only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can grant a role.

seg-source.mrk: Before you can grant a role to a user or to another role, you must create the role using the <xref href="rrefcreaterole.dita#rrefcreaterole">CREATE ROLE statement</xref>.
Only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can grant a role.

target.mrk: Before you can grant a role to a user or to another role, you must create the role using the <xref href="rrefcreaterole.dita#rrefcreaterole">CREATE ROLE statement</xref>.
Only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can grant a role.

trans-unit.source: A role A contains another role B if role B is granted to role A, or is contained in a role C granted to role A. Privileges granted to a contained role are inherited by the containing roles. So the set of privileges identified by role A is the union of the privileges granted to role A and the privileges granted to any contained roles of role A.

seg-source.mrk: A role A contains another role B if role B is granted to role A, or is contained in a role C granted to role A. Privileges granted to a contained role are inherited by the containing roles.
So the set of privileges identified by role A is the union of the privileges granted to role A and the privileges granted to any contained roles of role A.

target.mrk: A role A contains another role B if role B is granted to role A, or is contained in a role C granted to role A. Privileges granted to a contained role are inherited by the containing roles.
So the set of privileges identified by role A is the union of the privileges granted to role A and the privileges granted to any contained roles of role A.

trans-unit.source: DELETE | INSERT | REFERENCES [ columnList ] | SELECT [ columnList ] | TRIGGER | UPDATE [ columnList ]

seg-source.mrk: DELETE | INSERT | REFERENCES [ columnList ] | SELECT [ columnList ] | TRIGGER | UPDATE [ columnList ]

target.mrk: DELETE | INSERT | REFERENCES [ columnList ] | SELECT [ columnList ] | TRIGGER | UPDATE [ columnList ]

trans-unit.source: columnList

seg-source.mrk: columnList

target.mrk: columnList

trans-unit.source: ( columnIdentifier [ , columnIdentifier ]* )

seg-source.mrk: ( columnIdentifier [ , columnIdentifier ]* )

target.mrk: ( columnIdentifier [ , columnIdentifier ]* )

trans-unit.source: Use the ALL PRIVILEGES privilege type to grant all of the privileges to the user or role for the specified table. You can also grant one or more table privileges by specifying a privilegeList.

seg-source.mrk: Use the ALL PRIVILEGES privilege type to grant all of the privileges to the user or role for the specified table.
You can also grant one or more table privileges by specifying a privilegeList.

target.mrk: Use the ALL PRIVILEGES privilege type to grant all of the privileges to the user or role for the specified table.
You can also grant one or more table privileges by specifying a privilegeList.

trans-unit.source: Use the DELETE privilege type to grant permission to delete rows from the specified table.

seg-source.mrk: Use the DELETE privilege type to grant permission to delete rows from the specified table.

target.mrk: Use the DELETE privilege type to grant permission to delete rows from the specified table.

trans-unit.source: Use the INSERT privilege type to grant permission to insert rows into the specified table.

seg-source.mrk: Use the INSERT privilege type to grant permission to insert rows into the specified table.

target.mrk: Use the INSERT privilege type to grant permission to insert rows into the specified table.

trans-unit.source: Use the REFERENCES privilege type to grant permission to create a foreign key reference to the specified table. If a columnList is specified with the REFERENCES privilege, the permission is valid on only the foreign key reference to the specified columns.

seg-source.mrk: Use the REFERENCES privilege type to grant permission to create a foreign key reference to the specified table.
If a columnList is specified with the REFERENCES privilege, the permission is valid on only the foreign key reference to the specified columns.

target.mrk: Use the REFERENCES privilege type to grant permission to create a foreign key reference to the specified table.
If a columnList is specified with the REFERENCES privilege, the permission is valid on only the foreign key reference to the specified columns.

trans-unit.source: Use the SELECT privilege type to grant permission to perform SELECT statements or selectExpressions on a table or view. If a column list is specified with the SELECT privilege, the permission is valid on only those columns. If no column list is specified, then the privilege is valid on all of the columns in the table.

seg-source.mrk: Use the SELECT privilege type to grant permission to perform SELECT statements or selectExpressions on a table or view.
If a column list is specified with the SELECT privilege, the permission is valid on only those columns.
If no column list is specified, then the privilege is valid on all of the columns in the table.

target.mrk: Use the SELECT privilege type to grant permission to perform SELECT statements or selectExpressions on a table or view.
If a column list is specified with the SELECT privilege, the permission is valid on only those columns.
If no column list is specified, then the privilege is valid on all of the columns in the table.

trans-unit.source: For queries that do not select a specific column from the tables involved in a SELECT statement or selectExpression (for example, queries that use COUNT(*)), the user must have at least one column-level SELECT privilege or table-level SELECT privilege.

seg-source.mrk: For queries that do not select a specific column from the tables involved in a SELECT statement or selectExpression (for example, queries that use COUNT(*)), the user must have at least one column-level SELECT privilege or table-level SELECT privilege.

target.mrk: For queries that do not select a specific column from the tables involved in a SELECT statement or selectExpression (for example, queries that use COUNT(*)), the user must have at least one column-level SELECT privilege or table-level SELECT privilege.

trans-unit.source: Use the TRIGGER privilege type to grant permission to create a trigger on the specified table.

seg-source.mrk: Use the TRIGGER privilege type to grant permission to create a trigger on the specified table.

target.mrk: Use the TRIGGER privilege type to grant permission to create a trigger on the specified table.

trans-unit.source: Use the UPDATE privilege type to grant permission to use the UPDATE statement on the specified table. If a column list is specified, the permission applies only to the specified columns. To update a row using a statement that includes a WHERE clause, you must have the SELECT privilege on the columns in the row that you want to update.

seg-source.mrk: Use the UPDATE privilege type to grant permission to use the UPDATE statement on the specified table.
If a column list is specified, the permission applies only to the specified columns.
To update a row using a statement that includes a WHERE clause, you must have the SELECT privilege on the columns in the row that you want to update.

target.mrk: Use the UPDATE privilege type to grant permission to use the UPDATE statement on the specified table.
If a column list is specified, the permission applies only to the specified columns.
To update a row using a statement that includes a WHERE clause, you must have the SELECT privilege on the columns in the row that you want to update.

trans-unit.source: grantees

seg-source.mrk: grantees

target.mrk: grantees

trans-unit.source: { authorizationIdentifier | roleName | PUBLIC } [ , { authorizationIdentifier | roleName | PUBLIC } ]*

seg-source.mrk: { authorizationIdentifier | roleName | PUBLIC } [ , { authorizationIdentifier | roleName | PUBLIC } ]*

target.mrk: { authorizationIdentifier | roleName | PUBLIC } [ , { authorizationIdentifier | roleName | PUBLIC } ]*

trans-unit.source: You can grant privileges or roles to specific users or roles or to all users. Use the keyword PUBLIC to specify all users. When PUBLIC is specified, the privileges or roles affect all current and future users. The privileges granted to PUBLIC and to individual users or roles are independent privileges. For example, a SELECT privilege on table <codeph>t</codeph> is granted to both PUBLIC and to the authorization ID <codeph>harry</codeph>. The SELECT privilege is later revoked from the authorization ID <codeph>harry</codeph>, but Harry can access the table <codeph>t</codeph> through the PUBLIC privilege.

seg-source.mrk: You can grant privileges or roles to specific users or roles or to all users.
Use the keyword PUBLIC to specify all users.
When PUBLIC is specified, the privileges or roles affect all current and future users.
The privileges granted to PUBLIC and to individual users or roles are independent privileges.
For example, a SELECT privilege on table <codeph>t</codeph> is granted to both PUBLIC and to the authorization ID <codeph>harry</codeph>.
The SELECT privilege is later revoked from the authorization ID <codeph>harry</codeph>, but Harry can access the table <codeph>t</codeph> through the PUBLIC privilege.

target.mrk: You can grant privileges or roles to specific users or roles or to all users.
Use the keyword PUBLIC to specify all users.
When PUBLIC is specified, the privileges or roles affect all current and future users.
The privileges granted to PUBLIC and to individual users or roles are independent privileges.
For example, a SELECT privilege on table <codeph>t</codeph> is granted to both PUBLIC and to the authorization ID <codeph>harry</codeph>.
The SELECT privilege is later revoked from the authorization ID <codeph>harry</codeph>, but Harry can access the table <codeph>t</codeph> through the PUBLIC privilege.

trans-unit.source: Either the object owner or the database owner can grant privileges to a user or to a role. Only the database owner can grant a role to a user or to another role.

seg-source.mrk: Either the object owner or the database owner can grant privileges to a user or to a role.
Only the database owner can grant a role to a user or to another role.

target.mrk: Either the object owner or the database owner can grant privileges to a user or to a role.
Only the database owner can grant a role to a user or to another role.

trans-unit.source: To grant the SELECT privilege on table <codeph>t</codeph> to the authorization IDs <codeph>maria</codeph> and <codeph>harry</codeph>, use the following syntax:
